attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
My plan to  give every British adult over 18 £10,000 instead of £500Billion to banks.

£500,000,000,000 / 50,000,000 = £10,000  

Per person:
£10,000 - Gross
(£2,500) - Tax
(£4,500) - Repayment of debt or high interest  savings account (£4550 is average credit card, loan, or  overdraft debt per British adult)

£3,000 - To spend  (inject into consumerism)

Benefits:

£125 Billion to  spend on schools and health
£225 Billion in the banks. Money owed to them,  so nobody can begrudge tax-payers money being spent on being bailed out.

£150 Billion to liven up the consumer market, or on house deposits to rejuvenate housing market.

Political  benefits:
Who wouldn't re-elect a government that gave each of us £3k and relieved unsecured debt?

Inflation:
Price and income policy for a year to offset sudden increase in spending power.

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
